snippet: Joseph Clancy, 58, who retired from the Secret Service in 2011 as special agent in charge of the Presidential Protective Division, will replace Julia Pierson, who resigned.
abstract: Pres Obama names Joseph Clancy as interim director of the Secret Service, following resignation of director Julia Pierson; an agency veteran who retired in 2011, Clancy's most recent assignment with agency was special agent in charge of the Secret Service's Presidential Protective Division.
lead_paragraph: Joseph Clancy, 58, who retired from the Secret Service in 2011 as special agent in charge of the Presidential Protective Division, will replace Julia Pierson, who resigned.

headline.main: Interim Secret Service Chief Was in President’s Detail
headline.print_headline: Retired Veteran of President’s Detail Will Temporarily Lead His Old Agency
